what: React Router for shiny Apps and Quarto
title: React Router for shiny Apps and Quarto
text: goal shinyReactRouter provide wrapper around React Router (v6).

title: React Router for shiny Apps and Quarto
text: can now add URL pages like :
code: library(shinyReactRouter)  HashRouter(   NavLink(to = "/", "Main"),   NavLink(to = "/analysis", "Analysis"),   Routes(     Route(path = "/", element = "Main content"),     Route(path = "/analysis", element = "Analysis content")   ) )

title: React Router for shiny Apps and Quarto
text: Install shinyReactRouter like :

title: React Router for shiny Apps and Quarto
text: order render objects server, observe user clicks page produced NavLink.shinyInput() (learn shiny.react *.shinyInput wrappers ). strongly recommended reload session using observeEvent({}) function ensure server objects renders properly users clicks new page. simple apps, wrapping server R code observe({}) also works. advanced apps recommended reload session. simple example using R Shiny:
code: # in the server # reload session when user clicks on new page observeEvent(c(input$page_1, input$page_2), {   session$reload() }) library(shinyReactRouter) library(shiny) library(DT)  ui <- fluidPage(   shinyReactRouter::HashRouter(     titlePanel("shinyReactRouter"),     sidebarLayout(       sidebarPanel(         shinyReactRouter::NavLink.shinyInput(           inputId = "page_home",           to = "/",           style = JS('({isActive}) => { return isActive ? {color: "red", textDecoration:"none"} : {}; }'),           "Home"),         br(),         shinyReactRouter::NavLink.shinyInput(           inputId = "page_analysis",           to = "/analysis",           style = JS('({isActive}) => { return isActive ? {color: "red", textDecoration: "none"} : {}; }'),           "Analysis"         ),         br(),         shinyReactRouter::NavLink.shinyInput(           inputId = "page_about",           to = "/about",           style = JS('({ isActive }) => { return isActive ? { color: "red", textDecoration: "none" } : {}; }'),           "About"         )       ),       mainPanel(         shinyReactRouter::Routes(           shinyReactRouter::Route(             path = "/",             element = div(               tags$h1("Home page"),               tags$h4("A basic example of shinyReactRouter."),               uiOutput(outputId = "contentHome")             )           ),           shinyReactRouter::Route(             path = "/analysis",             element = div(               tags$h1("Analysis"),               DT::DTOutput("table")               )           ),           shinyReactRouter::Route(             path = "/about",             element = div(               uiOutput(outputId = "contentAbout")             )           ),           shinyReactRouter::Route(path = "*", element = div(tags$p("Error 404")))         )       )     )   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {      # reload session when user clicks on new page   # observeEvent(c(input$page_home, input$page_analysis, input$page_about), {   #   session$reload()   # })      # all R code in an observer   observe({     output$contentHome <- renderUI({       p("Content home")     })     output$table <- renderDT({       data.frame(x = c(1, 2), y = c(3, 4))     })     output$contentAbout <- renderUI({       div(         tags$h1("About"),         p("Content about")       )     })   }) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: React Router for shiny Apps and Quarto
text: example using MUI Material UI components shinyMaterialUI R package:
code: # remotes::install_github("lgnbhl/shinyMaterialUI") library(shiny) library(shinyMaterialUI) library(shinyReactRouter)   ui <- shinyMaterialUIPage(   shinyReactRouter::HashRouter(     CssBaseline(     Typography("shinyReactRouter with shinyMaterialUI", variant = "h5", m = 2),     Stack(       direction = "row", spacing = 2, p = 2,       Paper(         MenuList(           shinyReactRouter::NavLink.shinyInput(             inputId = "page_home",             to = "/",             style = JS('({isActive}) => { return isActive ? {color: "red", textDecoration:"none"} : { textDecoration: "none" }; }'),             MenuItem(               "home"             )           ),           br(),           shinyReactRouter::NavLink.shinyInput(             inputId = "page_analysis",             to = "/analysis",             style = JS('({isActive}) => { return isActive ? {color: "red", textDecoration: "none"} : { textDecoration: "none" }; }'),             MenuItem(               "Analysis"             )           ),           br(),           shinyReactRouter::NavLink.shinyInput(             inputId = "page_about",             to = "/about",             style = JS('({ isActive }) => { return isActive ? { color: "red", textDecoration: "none" } : { textDecoration: "none" }; }'),             MenuItem(               "About"             )           )         )       ),       Box(         shinyReactRouter::Routes(           shinyReactRouter::Route(             path = "/",             element = div(               tags$h1("Home page"),               tags$h4("A basic example of shinyReactRouter with shinyMaterialUI."),               uiOutput(outputId = "contentHome")             )           ),           shinyReactRouter::Route(             path = "/analysis",             element = div(               tags$h1("Analysis"),               uiOutput(outputId = "contentAnalysis")               )           ),           shinyReactRouter::Route(             path = "/about",             element = uiOutput(outputId = "contentAbout")           ),           shinyReactRouter::Route(path = "*", element = div(tags$p("Error 404")))         )       )     )     )   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {      # reload session when user clicks on new page   # observeEvent(c(input$page_home, input$page_analysis, input$page_about), {   #   session$reload()   # })      # all R code in an observer   observe({      output$contentHome <- renderUI({       p("Content home")     })     output$contentAnalysis <- renderUI({       p("Content analysis")     })     output$contentAbout <- renderUI({       div(         tags$h1("About"),         p("Content about")       )     })   }) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: React Router for shiny Apps and Quarto
text: Thanks client side routing provided React Router, can also create multiple pages Quarto Rmarkdown documents (server required). TODO: create Quarto example.
code: library(shinyReactRouter)  HashRouter(   NavLink(to = "/", "Main"),   NavLink(to = "/analysis", "Analysis"),   Routes(     Route(path = "/", element = "Main content"),     Route(path = "/analysis", element = "Analysis content")   ) )
